intro: Pecluma alfredii var. occidentalis, commonly known as the Western African pecluma, is a flowering plant native to parts of West Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its wetland habitat.
